clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of Cinitapride Tablets in the Treatment of Mild to Moderate Functional Dyspepsia
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-blind, Double-dummy, Active Drug Parallel Controlled, Multi-center Clinical Trial on the Efficacy and Safety of Cinitapride Tablets in the Treatment of Mild to Moderate Functional Dyspepsia

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare Cinitapride tablets with domperidone tablets (motilium), and to evaluate the efficacy and safety of Cinitapride tablets in the treatment of mild to moderate functional dyspepsia.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Response rate of overall symptom improvement after 4-weeks treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage change of overall symptom score of functional dyspepsia from baseline after 2 and 4 weeks treatment

Percentage change of individual symptom score (early satiety, discomfort with fullness after meal, flatulence, epigastric pain, epigastric burning, nausea, vomiting and belching) after 2 and 4 weeks treatment compared with the baseline
Changes of gastric emptying in some patients after 4-week treatment
Patient's global subjective assessment (Likert scale score) after 2 and 4 weeks treatment

intervention.description: cinitapride 1 mg for each dose, 3 mg/daily, for 4 weeks
10 mg for each dose ,30 mg/daily, for 4 weeks
